WRITING.TEXT: I'd personally rather take the ARM hit for the extra range. The +STR bonus doesn't really matter since 3rd Rank + Tale is enough to guarantee a KB. More importantly, range is what keeps you outside the reach of enemy archers, so -ARM matters less.

WRITING.TITLE: To the developers: A request to officialize mods
WRITING.TEXT: *Dear Devs,* Would you please consider turning a few community mods into official patches down the line? There is one (or two, depending on how you count it) specific ones which I had in mind: 1. [YaK's SSLTBS1 Fixpack](http://stoicstudio.com/forum/showthread.php?3698-MOD-YaK-s-SSLTBS1-Fixpack-(Spare-Some-Love-To-Banner-Saga-1) 1. [Drake's and YaK's BS2 Fixpack](http://stoicstudio.com/forum/showthread.php?3784-MOD-Drake-s-and-YaK-s-BS2-Fixpack) These are the most popular, but they seem to be outdated all the time. And although you're working on sequel development, they shouldn't be too difficult to implement; it's mostly just some variables to change and assign. *Yours Sincerely,* *subject6309*
i've spent way too much time trying to make this rhyme
Same story here. Whenever the mods break due to an update I can't bear continuing a playthrough, knowing that there would be missing events and typos abound.

I've personally gone with the mobile version, but in the end, it really depends on your needs. Both are the same content-wise; if you prefer the touchscreen interface and like playing games away from home then by all means, go for the mobile experience.

I'm all for mod support. I just wish that the devs could try and adopt some of the more pressing bugfix-y ones instead of pushing out minor but otherwise mod-breaking updates.

Good move. China has a gigantic market (as PUBG has shown), and fantasy/Strategy games have a big following in East Asia. What *is* concerning is the release on WeGame. If a publisher (see: Tencent) gets exclusive distribution rights down the road, it usually means a loss of dev support and the game ultimately becoming neglected.

1. Go to your Steam Library 2. Right click "The Banner Saga 2" if you have it and click Properties. 3. Navigate to General gt; Set Launch Options. 4. In the popup, type in "Developer" and hit `OK`. 4. Launch the game. You should see a little plus-sign at the top right corner. 5. Press and hold down `Ctrl` `Shift` `~`. This should bring up a console. 6. Enter the following into the console, line by line, and hitting `Enter` after every line. saga bookmark bk_battle_king saga roster_add warped_stoneguard_1 saga roster_add warped_scourge_1 7. Click each of the new icons to add them to the lineup. Good luck and have fun! Edit: Once you're done, repeat steps 1 to 4, but keep the field in 4 blank. If you are experiencing any console errors afterwards, do steps 1 and 2, then navigate to Local Files gt; Verify Integrity of Game Files

WRITING.TITLE: i will post one overused meme per day until i beat battle 40 on Survival (Day 1)

WRITING.TEXT: You played through the ending of the second game and didn't catch that it was a cliffhanger?

gt; Rook/Alette's whole journey was just to get people to safety I'm just gonna let Juno put across the magnitude of Alette/Rook's purpose in saving the world: *"The civilization we have now can live on only if civilized people live. When faced with disaster, we often slip into savagery. You saw what happened in Boersgard."* *....* *Who (the survivors) are when they reach Arberrang is exactly why they are important. Fear will soon spread like flames across dry tinder in that town. Without this caravan's hope, all will be consumed and burned to ash."*
